boardgame.name: Tokyo Coin Laundry Rulebook - Coin Laundry RPG
boardgame.description:
User Description:

This RPG item is the rulebook for the board game "kit" Tokyo Coin Laundry. Tokyo Coin Laundry contains a set of game components and a pamphlet that contains the rules for several games that can be played using those components. One of the games included in the rulebook is Coin Laundry RPG. The credits information is only for Coin Laundry RPG.

From the introduction:
Welcome laundry doers! In Coin Laundry RPG, you will play as a Japanese member of society, doing your laundry, and you are in a mood! Will that mood lead to fulfillment, or complaining. There is only one way to find out.

boardgame.name: Resources War Game
boardgame.description:
In this world very similar to ours, where overpopulation and human greed led to the depletion of practically all the resources on the planet ...

This scarcity of resources sparked internal wars between the nations of each continent without end.

After many years of small wars, combined with countless revolts and coups d'état, panic, fear, despair, led the few remaining nations in this world to start a war like no other! One last war. A war that nobody could escape, that would come to reach the 4 corners of the globe.

That was how the third world war started, also called by many the “War of resources”.

What will be the last nation to stand and gain control of the few resources in the world?

It is up to you to choose one of the remaining nations and dominate what is left of the world.

The objective of the game is to conquer a certain number of territories according to the number of players.

We have two types of troops, some that allow you to pass through the water and others that are only territorial.

A game of escalation where everyone can lose.

Inspired on the one hit wonder song 99 by Nena.


A standard deck of cars is dealt evenly among the players.

A token for each player is put at the beginning of the Cold War track, and another token is put in the World War track.

In each round, every player clockwise takes an action:
- Escalate: play a higher card in the same suit, or any card if you don't have any in suit.
- Stand down: pass until next round.
- Challenge: Play a 9 card (trump, black 9s, and super trump, red 9s).

Play continues until all but one player passes, or if two same-color 9s are played. The player who played the highest on-suit card (or trump or supertrump) takes all the cards played this round.

Set aside all 9s played each round. When all four 9s are played, the hand is over. At the end of the hand, discard any cards in your hand, then add up points for the cards you collected by winning rounds.

If your score was positive, advance your token in the Cold War track. Then, if any player has negative points, take the lowest score and add it to the World War track. If any player reaches the end of the Cold War track, they win. If the World War track reaches its end before any player wins, everyone loses.


99 is a postcard game sent to Board Game of the Month Club subscribers in the February 2017 package.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: One-Hit Wonder Songs postcards (Button Shy)

boardgame.name: Vampire: The Eternal Struggle Fifth Edition
boardgame.description:
Vampire: The Eternal Struggle Fifth Edition is a boxed set with five pre-constructed decks, rulebook, blood counters, and everything else you need to play the game.

Decks inside the box:

• Malkavian – This deck is a fast machine of devastation. Your vampires use Obfuscate stealth tactics to sneak past blockers and deliver heavy bleed attacks powered by Dominate. Your combat defense is limited, but who needs protection when your rivals are already ousted?

• Nosferatu – This deck starts slowly, building a domain with animal servants and other precautionary measures. You scare off early aggressors or lay traps for them. When the time is right, your vampires strike your enemies’ weak spots with their Potence and Animalism powers. Establish control over the game and put down your rivals one by one.

• Toreador – This deck will establish political control of the game and reap heavy rewards. Trick opponents to block the “wrong” actions to sneak through devastating blows. Defensive measures are at a minimum – instead focus on overwhelming your prey and maximize profit.

• Tremere – This deck is a flexible toolbox. You can either build slowly, getting equipment and mustering many vampires, or put constant pressure on your prey with Dominate-powered bleed actions. Your vampires can either avoid unhealthy encounters or choose to battle when your hand is full of Blood Sorcery combat cards. Your defense is strong – your vampires are always on high alert!

• Ventrue – This deck applies constant pressure with both nefarious politics and heavy bleeding using Presence and Dominate. Your vampires are tireless, fueled with Fortitude powers, and can hail multiple actions towards your enemy each turn. Your defenses are sturdy, with resilient minions and abilities to redirect attacks.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Into the Lion's Mouth: The Second Anglo-Sikh War 1848 -1849
boardgame.description:
Following the British victory in the First Anglo-Sikh War (1845 – 1846) the Lahore Durbar, the Sikh Government of the Punjab, effectively came under the control of the British East India Company. In April 1848, two British officers were sent to the prosperous south western city of Multan to take over the running of the province from its governor, Diwan Mulraj Chopra. They were murdered by soldiers of the city’s garrison, apparently acting spontaneously and without the prior knowledge of the startled Mulraj. Nonetheless, after some prevarication, he supported their actions, and thereby found himself the leader of a rebellion against the British.
There were few Sikhs in that part of the Punjab: the garrison was mainly Muslim, and the Mulraj was a Hindu. Because of this, the East India Company regarded the uprising as a purely local affair and sent troops to lay siege to Multan in the expectation that this would quell the rebellion. These included a large body of Sikhs, supposedly loyal to the British, under the command of Sher Singh.

It is now late October 1848. Coming to sympathize with the Mulraj’s grievances against the British and to appreciate how these are shared by the Sikhs, Sher Singh has changed sides. His men have withdrawn from the siege and are marching north east towards the Punjabi capital, Lahore. Sher Singh’s father, Chattar Singh, has also rebelled against the British and is besieging the fort at Attock which guards the road to Afghanistan. Inspired by the defiance of Sher Singh and Chattar Singh, anti-British disturbances have broken out in towns and cities across the western Punjab.

In response, units of the British East India Company are assembling at Firozpur where they will become the “Army of the Punjab”, under the command of Lord Gough. Gough plans to march against Sher Singh before he is reinforced by Chattar Singh. The monsoon season has ended. Campaigning can commence. So begins the Second Anglo-Sikh War 1848 – 1849.

Into the Lion’s Mouth is a two-player beer-and-pretzels game which gives players the opportunity to replicate the British success in re-establishing control over the Punjab, or to re-write history by leading the Sikhs to victory.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Mondo Deck of Fate
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Mondo Deck of Fate is the improved version of the standard Deck of Fate (see “Artifacts” in SenZar), having some 100 possible effects.

boardgame.name: Borel Dice Edition
boardgame.description:
Follow-up game to Borel. This game only contains cards with experiments with dice. The rules are different, and there is more emphasis on speed.

The general framework is like in Borel. The cards describe probability experiments with yes/no answers, for example: "You roll the d10 four times. Will the maximum roll exceed 8?"

You draw a card, and read aloud the question, the players vote yes or no, and you then conduct the experiment. Being good at probability will give you an advantage, but you can also win if the dice roll your way.

In the original game, you bet various amounts of money using chips, and you reveal your bets simultaneously. In this game, the first person to put forward their yes/no card, becomes the "Leader" and gets their preferred outcome, while all the others must bet on the opposite outcome. You get 3 points if you bet correctly. The experiment is then performed a second time, where the players are allowed to bet freely, except for the Leader, and you score 2 points if you bet correctly. First player to 25 points win.

By being the first to commit to a bet and becoming the Leader, you can force all the others to bet the opposite. However, the Leader is not allowed to change their bet in the second round, so betting too quickly can be dangerous, too.

boardgame.name: The Exiles: Magicks of the Endworld
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

These are the end times.

The scholars can tell of the rise and fall of a hundred Golden Ages, but the dark times between the pinnacles of civilization survived knowing the light would return.

boardgame.name: The Vasjan Heresy
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When the party is hired to capture and arrest a heretical priestess, they find themselves thrown into a political quagmire, caught between orthodoxy, heresy and the ambitions of two rival timber barons.

The Vasjan Heresy is a One-Sheet Scenario designed for use with Age of Ambition: Fantasy Roleplaying in an Age of Promise or Peril.

boardgame.name: It Really Ties The Room Together
boardgame.description:
A game about replacing your defiled rug.

It Really Ties The Room Together is a postcard game to be played with a standard deck of cards, inspired by The Big Lebowski, released in the Board Game of the Month Club February 2016 package.

There's a little tactical element of the placement of your cards, and there's also a cool card draft where you can just ditch the whole pile of cards and end the round, but at the heavy cost of going last next turn. All in all, a fun little game inspired by a fun little movie.

boardgame.name: Sekskantet Domino
boardgame.description: Dominoes with tri-coloured hexagonal tiles.

boardgame.name: Pass The Pot
boardgame.description:
A dynamic push-your-luck dice rolling game.

The gameplay is so simple:

STEP 1 - Roll it.

STEP 2 - Get as high as you can.

STEP 3 - Pass it.

Filled with 55 coins and custom dice, and a pot, players compete to win the pot, and be the first to accumulate 24 coins.

As the janitor at an apartment building you meet three charming tenants as they have issues in the apartment...

boardgame.name: Scissorcards
boardgame.description:
A bush sculpting game for 3-5 players.

Inspired on the cult film Edward Scissorhands.


Scissorcards is a realtime dexterity game where you have to form a shrub using playing cards BUT you have to use playing cards instead of your fingers. You setup cards in-between each finger and that's all you get to work with.

The dealer announces start and all players must use their card hands to flip the cards in the center pool and manipulate them to create their bush.

When the dealer decides that a player has built a bush that matches the example bush, the dealer will announce that person as the winner.

The winner scores 1 point. Play continues so that all players have been the dealer. The player with the highest score after that is the winner.


Postcard released in the March 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

boardgame.name: Min Lidl Butik
My Lidl World

User Summary

boardgame.name: Mausritter: Boxed Set (2nd Ed)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Take up the sword and don the whiskers of a brave mouse adventurer in Mausritter, the rules-light fantasy adventure role-playing game.

It’s a huge and dangerous world out there, and it does not look kindly on a small mouse. But if you are very brave and very clever and just a bit lucky, you might survive. And if you survive long enough, you might even become a hero amongst mice.

- Fierce, fast and flavourful character creation get you playing your mouse adventurer as quickly as possible.
- Physical card-based inventory keeps bookkeeping to a minimum and hard choices to a maximum.
- Dangerous and evocative magic system with 15 spells to find and cast.
- Generous toolboox of resources provide the Game Master with support to create mouse-scale sandbox adventures.
- Delve into the ready to play adventure site of Stumpsville and explore further into the Earldom of Ek.

Written & illustrated by Isaac Williams.

Boxed set includes:

- Rulesbook (44 pages, hard-cover with mousehole)
- GM screen
- Adventure module Honey in the Rafters
- Set of inventory cards & dry-erase maker
- Pad of character sheets

Limited run of 500 copies.

boardgame.name: Along Came a Patriot
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An Espionage Mystery that unfolds over five decades!

Along Came a Patriot is an adventure chain and series of prompts for the Cold Shadows roleplaying game that takes place from the 1950s to the 1990s, covering five decades and the growth and decline of the Cold War, from Budapest to Berlin and finally to the halls of the CIA Headquarters in Langley.

The unique narrative nature of Cold Shadows means this adventure set is a collection of set-pieces, prompts, events, and ideas for the Narrator to fill in, alongside their players, throughout play and at the tabletop. The adventure is a campaign structure explicitly designed for the unique storytelling nature of Cold Shadows, and contains a brief guide on how to run Cold Shadows and a small FAQ based on questions from Kickstarter backers.

boardgame.name: The Great American Witch
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Great American Witch is a modern gothic tabletop roleplaying game about the secret world of witches in America and the supernatural threats working to destroy them.

Built on Christopher Grey's award-nominated RPG framework The Great American Novel, the game focuses on powerful witches who use ancient magic drawn from the feminine forces of creation. They struggle to balance their everyday lives, the supernatural, secret societies, and personal conflicts within their covens.

The Great American Witch uses a framework similar to Powered by the Apocalypse Games, FATE, and indy storytelling games like Ten Candles. It is, however, designed for extended campaign play in the tradition of World of Darkness or other urban fantasy traditional games.

boardgame.name: Electric Bastionland (Free Edition)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a free version of Electric Bastionland featuring the player-facing side of the rules and ten of the over one-hundred Failed Careers from the full game.

Bastion - The Electric Hub of Mankind

The only city that matters. Too big to fall, too complicated to function. A mess of alleyways, legalese and crowds. Aliens, Mockeries and People always in your way and your business.

Everybody’s here.

Everything is here.

In Deep Country, the land stretches forever. The long shadow of our embarrassing past. Villages rot away, trees don’t bother to flower anymore, and the potato is eaten cold from the ground. Things were better before. Better before Bastion.

In the Underground are impossible tunnels beneath time and space. Devious machines release their creations into the corridors. All while the twisting network grows and touches everything. Connects everything. You can get anywhere, but there’s always a challenge.

You have a failed career and a colossal debt.

Treasure is your only option.

A spark of hope in Electric Bastionland.

Electric Bastionland is a roleplaying game written by Chris McDowall, author of the critically-acclaimed Into The Odd. It uses and expands upon the systems developed in Into The Odd, resulting in a rules-set that’s easy to run as a Referee and even easier to play. It’s not a sourcebook or an expansion - it’s a standalone journey into an unknowable world.

boardgame.name: Legendary Planet Player's Guide (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Awesome Options for Interplanetary Adventure!

The Legendary Planet Player's Guide offers an amazing array of all-new options for Pathfinder Second Edition adventure, including four fantastic ancestries complete with over 60 ancestry feats and heritages, special equipment, and more! You'll find everything you need to use the clockwork-cybernetic auttaine, the chlorvian plant people, the four-armed psychic tretharri, and the mischievous winged reptilian zvarr in any campaign from fantasy to sci-fi.

Plus, if you're using the Legendary Planet Adventure Path, you'll find 11 campaign feats, a complete pantheon of 20 deities, and tons of character advice to give you and your players a roadmap to guide their path to adventure among the stars!

boardgame.name: Escape the Dark Sector: Mission Pack 1 – Twisted Tech
boardgame.description:
Discover the bizarre and disturbing technology of the far future, where sinister intentions and limitless possibilities collide...

Contains:

1 New Boss: Face-off against an evil uber-genius obsessed with neural implants

12 New Chapters: Four per act, exploring the stations tech-skewed terrors

10 New Items: Including deadly new weaponry and powerful new cybernetics

7 New Dice: Special new Ammo Dice to accompany the enhanced firepower on offer, plus a 'Tech die' - used to determine the effects of certain chapters and items, as well as bringing a new challenge to the final battle

New Mechanics: Tactical Drone Selection. During setup, choose which drone your crew will take on the mission. The 'Activate Drone' action now includes a choice of drone ability to trigger, and is no longer limited to merely healing.

boardgame.name: Escape the Dark Sector: Mission Pack 2 – Mutant Syndrome
boardgame.description:
Exposed to cosmic radiation and mysterious alien substances, the bodies of many station denizens have begun to gruesomely distort - as have your own...

Contains:

1 New Boss: Encounter an advanced and powerful alpha-mutant.

12 New Chapters : Four per act, plagued by horrific mutant adversaries.

3 New Crew Members: Loyal alien specialists eager to join the mission.

8 New Item Cards: Gruesome crew-mutations, and powerful new cybernetics.

4 New Dice: Three new crew dice, plus a 'Mutation die' used to determine the effects of certain chapters and items, as well as bringing a new challenge to the final battle.

New Mechanic: Mutations! Crew Members can now fall prey to mutations during the mission, warping their bodies and bringing about both negative and positive effects.

boardgame.name: Escape the Dark Sector: Mission Pack 3 – Quantum Rift
boardgame.description:
The very fabric of what you consider real is shattered as you hurtle through time and space - coming face to face with legendary dangers of the distant past...

Contains:

1 New Boss: Battle a creature who wields time itself as a weapon.

12 New Chapters: Four per act, including dangerous historical settings.

3 New Crew Members: Versatile alien friendlies, keen to do take up the fight.

8 New Item Cards: Quest Items, a new type of item card found only in specific time-travel chapters.

4 New Dice: Three crew dice, plus a 'Time die' - used to determine the effects of certain chapters and item cards, as well as bringing a new challenge to the final battle.

New Mechanic: Time Travel! With every turn of a chapter card, hold your breath as you risk plummeting through a rift in time, coming face to face with deadly threats from the distant past.

boardgame.name: Devil King High School: Year One
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Devil King School of Higher Learning is looking for new students this school year. Those who accept the school’s invitation will be sent to Minauros, the third layer of the Nine Hells. Will the adventu—I mean students—survive the tests given to them by their devilish professors? Part One of I Got Accepted as a Student in the Nine Hells and Now I'm at the Top of the Class series.

A Two-Hour Adventure for Level 1-4 Characters. Optimized for Average Party Level 3.

boardgame.name: The Phantom Pursuit
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Caravan duty in the Cormanthor forest can be dangerous, but normally you only have to deal with bandits and the odd goblin. No-one said anything about the undead, but now you're being chased by a malevolent spirit!

Can you escape - or will you die trying?

A Two-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.
...
CCC-ARCANA-01: The Phantom Pursuit is Part One of a two-part series, but it can also be played as a standalone adventure. Check out CCC-ARCANA-02: Seclusion for Part Two!

boardgame.name: Seclusion
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The sleepy and idyllic little villagers of Kuringrove know of a well-kept secret deep in the Cormanthor Forest. If you're lucky, you might stumble across the home of two elderly seers, who have lived here for longer than there's even been a village.

They may be the only ones who can provide answers for all the strange goings on in the forest!

A Two-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.
...
CCC-ARCANA-02: Seclusion is the follow up adventure to CCC-ARCANA-01: The Phantom Pursuit, however both adventures can be played stand alone.

boardgame.name: Dancing with Bullets Under a Neon Sun
boardgame.description:
From the kickstarter:

Dancing with Bullets Under a Neon Sun is a weird cyberpunk RPG for fans of the OSR. Although based on The Black Hack, it is not just a clone with renamed classes, building on the system to create a new experience, introducing new mechanics to suit the setting and tone, and revamping character creation.
boardgame.rpg: Dancing with Bullets Under a Neon Sun

boardgame.name: The Hike That Binds Us
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Hike that Binds Us is a Role Playing Game (RPG) designed to simulate the overall experience and sense of adventure felt during a long distance Hike. Players act as hikers who navigate the network of trails to not only finish he hike, but to try and survive. Players create custom characters, develop their backstory, and fill their backpack with items, all before they meet one another. So when they meet, no one knows each other, or what they brought! During the game, hikers will choose between different actions (travelling, crafting, hunting, fishing, etc.), and attempt tot survive while interacting with the slanderous wilderness around them.
...
Included files:

Trail Manual
Character Sheet
Log Book Sheet
Trail Description Sheet
The Westfield Network of Trails - MAP
South Canyon Heights - MAP & EXPANSION
Forest Goblin - EXPANSION

boardgame.name: Hell's Gate Keep
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This fortress sits at one of the very few places where living morals may enter hell. On a small rocky outcropping surrounded by molten lava and guarded by six stone statues lies the magical gateway which can only be opened by the sacrifice of a mortal life.

A loose path takes you toward the iron gate of the keep, where within a small foyer awaits. To your right lies the kitchen, a small armory and a staircase leading to an office space. While yo your left is a table sprawling with paperwork and some crates containing mysterious items. Stairs take you deeper into the keep past a holding area, sleeping quarters, and small library and then finally to large circular chamber with runic words engraved into the ground.

boardgame.name: Phisbann's Magical Keep
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This fortress sits high up on the shear cliffs, carved into it’s face with but a small rocky outcropping where six stone statues guard the one and only way to this place, a magical gateway which emanates purple energy.

A loose path takes you toward the iron gate of the keep, where within a small foyer awaits. To your right lies the kitchen, a small armory and a staircase leading to an office space. While yo your left is a table sprawling with paperwork and some crates containing mysterious items. Stairs take you deeper into the keep past a holding area, sleeping quarters, and small library and then finally to large circular chamber with runic words engraved into the ground.

boardgame.name: Orbital Fortress
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This magical fortress orbits the world far off in the bleak darkness of space. Six stone statues guard the one and only way to this place, a magical gateway which emanates purple energy on a rocky outcropping.

A loose path takes you toward the iron gate of the keep, where within a small foyer awaits. To your right lies the kitchen, a small armory and a staircase leading to an office space. While yo your left is a table sprawling with paperwork and some crates containing mysterious items. Stairs take you deeper into the keep past a holding area, sleeping quarters, and small library and then finally to large circular chamber with runic words engraved into the ground.

boardgame.name: Forest Cavern's Entrance
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A rivulet meanders through this lush forest, full of blooming white flowers and extensive ferns. You hear the sound of birds chirping and can smell the sweet scent of pine needles on the breeze. A small path leads up a rocky escarpment and over the small stream ending in a large opening to a dark craggy entrance in the cliffs face.

boardgame.name: Beastmen's Forest Shrine
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A rivulet meanders through the forested encampment of the Beastmen. Wooden barricades have been erected, skulls and bones mounted on their bloodied sharped ends. Tents made of furs and sewn skins sit around burned out camp fires.

A path leads up a rocky escarpment and over the small stream and to a shrine with a large skull, fires lit in it’s empty eyes. Cages hang from chains on the cliff face and more skulls have been mounted on pikes.

boardgame.name: Apocalyptic Gang's Shrine
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A path leads up a rocky escarpment and over a dry creek bed which meanders through the rocky desert. Here a shrine with a large skull, fires lit in it’s empty eyes sits. Cages hang from chains on the cliff face behind it, bleached skeletons within.

boardgame.name: The Rainbow Forest
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A prismatic rivulet meanders through this lush rainbow forest, full of blooming flowers and extensive ferns. You hear the sound of creatures chirping and can smell a strange sweet scent on the breeze. A small path leads up a rocky escarpment and over the small stream ending in opening in the forest.

boardgame.name: Beastmen's Winter Camp
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An icy creek meanders through the forested encampment of the Beastmen. Wooden barricades have been erected, skulls and bones mounted on their bloodied sharped ends. Tents made of furs and sewn skins sit around burned out camp fires.

A path leads up a rocky escarpment and over the small stream and to a shrine with a large skull, fires lit in it’s empty eyes. Cages hang from chains on the cliff face and more skulls have been mounted on pikes.

Adventure Seed

You return to the village to find it a complete warzone, doors have been hacked down and roofs have been set ablaze. Bloody patches and drag marks line the ground but, no bodies are to be found. Leading away from the village, you notice several footprints that appear to be human lead by other hooved marks.

If you search the village you may find two living children, a young girl and a teenage boy hiding in a secret crawl space under the floorboards of one of the houses, a woven rug covering it. Blood has drenched the floor and carpet above the small space, dripping down to cover the poor terrified girl.

If asked what happened, the teenage boy will explain the village was attacked while cradling his little sister who is still crying. Out of no where a band of men who were horribly deformed, having the heads of beasts and thick fur beset the village. Their parents told them to hide in the small space when the attack happened but there was no extra space for themselves.

What’s going on? A tribe of beastmen from within the darkest parts of the forest have awakened an evil spirit within the carved skull of an ancient beast. This spirit has been demanding sacrifices on the twelfth hour every night in order to be appeased or threatens bad omens upon the tribe. Because of this the beastmen have been raiding nearby towns for sacrifices, lest they sacrifice their own.

If you arrive in time you may be able to save the children parents and other townsfolk from their fate.

boardgame.name: Starlit Beastmen's Encampment
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A muddy creek meanders through the starlit, dark forested encampment of the Beastmen. Wooden barricades have been erected, skulls and bones mounted on their bloodied sharped ends. Tents made of furs and sewn skins sit around burned camp fires and blazing torches.

A path leads up a rocky escarpment and over the small stream and to a shrine with a large skull, fires lit in it’s empty eyes. Cages hang from chains on the cliff face and more skulls have been mounted on pikes.

Adventure Seed

You return to the village to find it a complete warzone, doors have been hacked down and roofs have been set ablaze. Bloody patches and drag marks line the ground but, no bodies are to be found. Leading away from the village, you notice several footprints that appear to be human lead by other hooved marks.

If you search the village you may find two living children, a young girl and a teenage boy hiding in a secret crawl space under the floorboards of one of the houses, a woven rug covering it. Blood has drenched the floor and carpet above the small space, dripping down to cover the poor terrified girl.

If asked what happened, the teenage boy will explain the village was attacked while cradling his little sister who is still crying. Out of no where a band of men who were horribly deformed, having the heads of beasts and thick fur beset the village. Their parents told them to hide in the small space when the attack happened but there was no extra space for themselves.

What’s going on? A tribe of beastmen from within the darkest parts of the forest have awakened an evil spirit within the carved skull of an ancient beast. This spirit has been demanding sacrifices on the twelfth hour every night in order to be appeased or threatens bad omens upon the tribe. Because of this the beastmen have been raiding nearby towns for sacrifices, lest they sacrifice their own.

If you arrive in time you may be able to save the children parents and other townsfolk from their fate.

boardgame.name: Beastmen's Encampment
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A muddy creek meanders through the dark forested encampment of the beastmen. Wooden barricades have been erected, skulls and bones mounted on their bloodied sharped ends. Tents made of furs and sewn skins sit around burned out camp fires.

A path leads up a rocky escarpment and over the small stream and to a shrine with a large skull, fires lit in it’s empty eyes. Cages hang from chains on the cliff face and more skulls have been mounted on pikes.

boardgame.name: Seacliff's Ruined Market
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This town has seen better days. Most of the buildings have began to crumble, walls and roofs falling in. Moss and weeds have also overgrown the cobblestone paths and started intruding into the remains of the houses. Wooden planks criss-cross the old buildings roofs, stone pillars and small alleyways.

boardgame.name: Tomb Looters: Live!
boardgame.description:
In a near-future, slightly magicified version of our world, you've been selected as one of the contestants in a new livecast reality show. You’ll compete against other treasure hunters to explore ancient tombs ripe for looting.

But to up the stakes, the producers have rigged a series of demolition charges and given some control of them to the contestants. Time is running out, and no one knows when the roof might cave in. Will you thwart your opponents and make it out with the most treasure ... or get trapped under a heap of dusty rubble?

With just a pencil, a print-and-play game sheet, and 2d6 for each player, you can play in person or over a video call.

The game plays in phases, and players play out each phase in the dark catacombs simultaneously and secretly, keeping their progress hidden. They move around the catacombs and roll their dice to unearth treasure, all while trying to avoid (or confront) their opponents. Looted treasures are kept secret, but after each phase players announce their positions and collapsed spaces on the map.

With your trusty GLM™ helping stow your treasures, you just might be able to snag the most loot. Oh, and getting out alive would also be nice.

boardgame.name: Tome of Beasts 2 Lairs
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

MONSTERS ON THE PROWL!


Savage beasts mauling a mountaintop temple.
A river tomb of lurking horrors.
A shrine infested with hungry undead.


Inside, you’ll find these adventures and 11 more! Created for the 5th Edition of the world’s first roleplaying game, these 14 standalone, single-map adventures each feature new monsters from Tome of Beasts II. Use these adventures as side missions alongside your ongoing campaign, or to fuel one or more standalone sessions. With adventures suitable for heroes of level 1–15, there are enough challenges—and mayhem—for everyone!

Stage your 5th Edition fights in unforgettable one-shot adventures including:


To Track a Thief, Level 1
The Forsaken Fort, Level 3
The Twisted Wreath, Level 3
Shrine of the Hungry Dead, Level 4
Tragedy at Thyrdun Outpost, Level 4
Caverns of the Crystalline Monolith, Level 5
Fight for Horseshoe Rock Oasis, Level 5
The River Tomb, Level 6
House of the Worm God, Level 7
Terror at the Mountain Lotus Temple, Level 8
Tunnels Beneath Skulltop Tor, Level 9
Crucible of Golems, Level 10
Fire and Fury, Level 13
Towers of the Three Regents, Level 15

boardgame.name: EXIT: Das Spiel – Die Entführung in Fortune City
Exit: The Game – Kidnapped in Fortune City
boardgame.description:
Can you solve the riddles and stop the kidnapping before it’s too late?

Criminal activity is rampant in the frontier town of Fortune City, and now the sheriff has disappeared without a trace. With precious little time to find him, players need to work together to solve the crime. Over the course of the game, your investigation will lead you through Fortune City, with clues and strange items to be found throughout. You will need to search for answers in the saloon, drugstore, gunsmith, post office, prison, and bank. But in a unique twist, you will decide the order in which you will visit these locations and who you will interrogate along the way. Together with your team, you will collect clues and evaluate the townspeoples’ testimonies. But will you get the answers you need to rescue the sheriff in time?

In the style of Dead Man on the Orient Express and Theft on the Mississippi, players must get to the bottom of a kidnapping in the Wild West in addition to solving all the riddles.

Difficulty level: 3.5 of 5

Exit: The Game – Kidnapped in Fortune City is a puzzle game modeled after escape rooms, and it includes components meant to be folded, written upon, or torn, so it's marketed as a single-use game.

boardgame.name: Questlings RPG
boardgame.description:
In Questlings: RPG, players will play as one character with two personas, one as your kid form and one as the Inner Hero your child aspires to be! This game guides players and game moderators through a map accompanied with a storybook to give them a rules-light framework for roleplaying and building the story.

Not only will you have two personas (your kid character and your fantasy Inner Hero) but the locations you adventure through will also have two different settings, the town you live in and the fantasy world you pretend it to be.

Each character has Goals to achieve when they go through the story. Once the characters have gained 3 Inventory items, they can go to their location of choice on the map to achieve their goal using those items! Goals can vary from winning at a martial arts competition to helping clean up the environment in the town!

When rolling dice, players mark advancement when they fail at a roll, so they can build towards adding cool new abilities, such as rerolling dice or moving more spaces on the map! The fantasy persona is also there to help boost the child character's confidence, letting them unlock cool new things that they can do in the game.

boardgame.name: Raffi Raffzahn
boardgame.description:
The stolen jewels must be returned to the princess! To do this, Raffi Raffzahn makes his way through the forest to the mysterious castle of the wizard bear — but the little dragon runs the risk of being turned into a piggy on every space.

Raffi Raffzahn is a magical-magnetic memo game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: De Crew: Missie Diepzee
The Crew: Mission Deep Sea
The Crew: Mission Sous-Marine
Die Crew: Mission Tiefsee
The Crew: Missione negli Abissi
Załoga: Wyprawa w głębiny
Экипаж: Погружение в бездну
딥 씨 크루: 심해에서의 임무
boardgame.description:
In the trick-taking card game The Crew: Mission Deep Sea, you and the other players work together to search for the lost continent of Mu. This new adventure takes your crew deep down into the abyss on a search for the fabled sunken land. How far you get depends entirely on how well you work together as a team. Card by card, trick by trick, your search party will discover the challenges that lie ahead and forge a path to Mu.

This new version of The Crew has the same innovative co-operative trick-taking mechanism as the highly lauded original game — but with some exciting new surprises! While communication between your crew members is severely limited by your submerged state, it is also critical to your success; finding the hidden land in the murky depths depends not only on winning tricks, but also on carefully negotiating the order in which they are won. If things don't go as planned, you might just be able to salvage the operation, but it will take near flawless execution and perhaps a little luck to finally reach Mu.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Welcher Dino leuchtet da?
boardgame.description: Welcher Dino leuchtet da? is a children's game that in English is named Which Dinosaur Shines Here?

boardgame.name: Ghost Ops: Operation Redcrow
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Two weeks ago the CDC was informed of a bacterial outbreak in a small African village on the outskirts of the DRC (Democratic Republic of Congo), understanding the dangers of the region the CDC still sent a research team along with a squad of UN troops as security. Every member of the team was chipped with trackers just in case it all went south, and it has.
boardgame.rpg: Ghost Ops: A Modern Day Covert Operations RPG

boardgame.name: プログラム言語神経衰弱 (Programming Language Memory)
boardgame.description:
There has been a communication breakdown. Players need to find the correct programming language and match them together.
There are ten programming languages and four cards in each language.

The game ends when all the cards have all been taken. Whoever has the most cards wins. If there is more than one person with the most cards, they share in the victory.

This educational game allows players to learn about coding, and to recognize the different languages. Even though some of the programming functions look very similar, there are subtle differences. Each card has a barcode pattern at the top to help those learning about programming languages.

'How to play'
Place all the cards face down on the table. When it's your turn, you can turn over two cards from the table, and if they are in the same language, you get them and can take another turn. If they are in a different language, turn them back face down, and it's the turn of the person next to you on the left.

boardgame.name: Narrative-Driven Character Creation
boardgame.description:
"In Dungeons & Dragons fifth edition, characters have traditionally gained an ability score increase trait through their race. Critiques have been raised questioning the narrative this mechanic evokes, and I ultimately agreed that, even with politics aside, race doesn’t feel like a pleasing place to put ability score increases. It causes certain race and class pairings to perform notably weaker than others, which may dissuade players from playing a race and class combination they had envisioned.

Though a new Lineage system is being created for Tasha’s Cauldron of Everything that proposes a solution, I’m of the opinion that the system previews we have seen as of writing this material wind up causing a massive shift in the overall balance behind character creation in several races, and min-maxing players will ultimately just see the system as a means to create “optimal” characters instead of compelling ones.

Narrative-Driven Character Creation seeks to meaningfully address this by proposing a new system for Ability Score Improvement based off of you character's Background and Class, then a change to alternate proficiencies that seeks to reduce the potential for tool proficiency bloat."

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: Etsi ja löydä: Safariseikkailu
boardgame.description:
A reimplementation of Muumi viidakkoseikkailu and Coral Reef, Etsi ja löydä Safariseikkailu is a game of fast reactions that has the players flipping two cards and trying to find the animals depicted in the cards from the board as soon as possible.

First player to find both animals scores a point, five points wins the game. Some rounds reward players with camera tokens and it's also possible to win the game by collecting two camera tokens.
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2020 Vuoden Peli Children's Game of the Year Winner

boardgame.name: Oriental Chess
boardgame.description: In this abstract strategy game, each player has 8 identical pieces. They move like rooks, but can't jump over any pieces or land on pieces. Instead, you can capture opponent's pieces either by inclusion of a string or by connecting two strings on a line. You win if you reduce your opponent to at most one piece, unless they can reduce you to at most one piece in their very next turn.

boardgame.name: Bollwerk 178
boardgame.description:
Bollwerk 178 is a Chess-like complex strategy game for two players.

Each player has 20 strong pieces and 25 supplementary stones at their disposal. The game is played on a board with 178 squares. The game board is in a constant state of change due to the supplementary stones.

The goal of the game is, occupying the opponent’s end field with a piece or a bomb. Whoever captures all his opponent’s pieces or immobilizes their opponent also wins.

On the board there is enormous potential for attacks, sheer unlimited possibilities for various positions, countless options for the next move, as well as an incredibly wide range of defense strategies.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Dragon Line: Fade and Flow
boardgame.description:
Dragon Line is a simultaneous-turns card battle with neat dragon art. The rules are very easy, and games go fast, but there is a lot of complexity to uncover, especially in understanding the ability combos.

Each player builds a small army of dragons with which to face their opponent, chooses in which order the dragons approach the enemy lines, and attempts to be the player with dragons remaining in hand at the end.

This expansion adds two new dragon types to the original Dragon Line deck. If you've bought the second edition of Dragon Line, you already have these cards!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Dove sei, piccolo Giallo?
boardgame.description:
Game inspired from the book "Little Blue and Little Yellow" it is a simple game in which there is a course based on the roll of the dice.
It is a two players game for little children in which there are boxes to balance the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: La Missione Impossibile di Giorgio il Drago
boardgame.description:
It is a card game. You have to collect a set of cards to win.
At your turn you can use some cards to block your opponents and obviously play some cards that free yourself if you are previously blocked.

The game is based on the novel of Geoffreoy de Pennart.

boardgame.name: Sblocca La Porta Deluxe
boardgame.description:
You are locked in a room and you must work together to find the way out, solving puzzles of logic, observation and mathematics. Use the objects you find in the room, observe the smallest details and do not be rushed: if you correctly solve all puzzles, you will leave the room!

The box includes 4 adventures: The Mistery of Orient Express,
The Treasure Island, The villa of Mr. Gold and the haunted house.

boardgame.name: Kamen Rider: SummonRide
boardgame.description:
https://kamenrider.fandom.com/wiki/Kamen_Rider_Summonride

Kamen Rider Summonride (仮面ライダーサモンライド Kamen Raidā Samon Raido) is an action-RPG crossover game. It was released in December, 2014. Developed by Eighting and Bandai Namco, the game is exclusive for the PlayStation 3 and Wii U. Similar to previous games of the franchise, Kamen Rider: Battride War. It features all of the main 2000's era riders (Heisei with the current Neo-Heisei).

boardgame.name: Kamen Rider Kuuga
boardgame.description:
https://kamenrider.fandom.com/wiki/Kamen_Rider_Kuuga_(video_...)

Kamen Rider Kuuga is a Japanese fighting game developed by Kaze and published by Bandai Namco Entertainment exclusively for the PlayStation, based on the continuity established in Kamen Rider Kuuga. Aside from several Grongi, Kuuga himself is playable in his Mighty, Dragon, Pegasus, Titan, and Ultimate forms.

boardgame.name: Kamen Rider Agito
boardgame.description:
https://kamenrider.fandom.com/wiki/Kamen_Rider_Agito_(video_...)

Kamen Rider Agito (仮面ライダーアギト Kamen Raidā Agito) is a fighting game based on the series of the same name.

boardgame.name: Kamen Rider Ryuki
boardgame.description:
https://kamenrider.fandom.com/wiki/Kamen_Rider_Ryuki_(video_...)

Kamen Rider Ryuki (仮面ライダー龍騎 Kamen Raidā Ryūki) is video game based on the Kamen Rider Ryuki series, developed by Digifloyd, edited/published by Bandai, and released in Japan in 2002, during the series airing, for the PlayStation. This is the last Kamen Rider video game released on PlayStation, after this, they would be released on PlayStation 2 until a certain time.
It is a basic fighting game where all 13 Kamen Riders are playable with all the forms seen in the show, movie and specials (with the exception of the Alternatives, Ouja's and Knight's Blank Form, seen respectively in Episode Final and Kamen Rider Art Collection Hero Hen, as well as any hypothetical Blank Forms. However, Ryuki's appears at the beginning of the Challenge Mode (it is actually unlockable, see unlockables below). Four of the Contract Monsters (Volcancer, Metalgelas, Destwilder and Gigazelle), the two Zebraskulls (Iron and Bronze) and Megazelle are also playable.

boardgame.name: Kamen Rider
boardgame.description:
https://kamenrider.fandom.com/wiki/Kamen_Rider_(video_game)

Kamen Rider (仮面ライダー Kamen Raidā, Masked Rider) is a Japanese fighting game developed by Kaze and Bandai Namco Entertainment exclusively for the PlayStation, featuring characters from the continuity of the original Kamen Rider series as playable characters. It was released in Japan in 1998.

boardgame.name: Kamen Rider V3
boardgame.description:
https://kamenrider.fandom.com/wiki/Kamen_Rider_V3_(video_gam...)

Kamen Rider V3 is a 2D Fighting game, developed by Kaze and published by Bandai Namco featuring the eponymous hero from the series of the same name which was released in Japan in 2000.

boardgame.name: Kamen Rider: The Bike Race
boardgame.description:
https://kamenrider.fandom.com/wiki/Kamen_Rider:_The_Bike_Race

Kamen Rider: The Bike Race is a 2001 racing video game for the Playstation/PSX system made by Bandai Entertainment and the 3rd installment of their Simple 2000 game series.[1]

Uniting the majority of Kamen Rider protagonists up to Kamen Rider Agito, this game served as one of the commemorative projects for the 30th anniversary of the Kamen Rider Series.

boardgame.name: First Level Dungeons
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

A compendium of OTR compatable adventures that can be used as a connected campaign or dropped into your existing campaign as one off adventures. Great writers of this tome include Steve Kenson (Mutants and Masterminds), Dave Woodrum (Fishwife Games) and talented first timers, Adam Steele, Anthony Constantino and Dante Parti-Smith. Art is by Dan SMIF Smith (as wel as a few adventures, too!) New NPCS/Monsters/Random Tables and maps for you to use and create your own scenarios!

boardgame.name: Starman
boardgame.description:
Guide Starman through breathtaking architectural sceneries with delicate atmospheres and elaborate puzzles. Recover the light, and bring life back!

CHALLENGING
New puzzles every level will keep you learning and thinking outside the box.

ATHMOSPHERIC
Starman is not only a game, but a whole experience. We've put so much love building the sceneries, and trying to create an eerie atmosphere. Sit, relax, and enjoy.

GAMEPLAY
We crafted more than 30 puzzles inside 24 levels, across 9 totally different chapters, to keep you playing between 1.5h and 3h.
It's short and sweet.

FLOW MODE
When you finish the main story, an endless flow mode will be unlocked for you.

NINDIE
Starman is our first game. 100% Indie, developed with love in spain by sergio abril and jacobo abril, two brothers that happen to be architects.

(from Nintendo.com website)

boardgame.name: Hot Sauce
boardgame.description:
Hot Sauce by Kenneth Thompson. Ken always has a bag of tricks and this one was in the form of about 20 Taco Bell hot sauce packets. He had a neat domino feel tile laying abstract game in which Ben and Jason tightened a wee bit. In the end it's two things: 1) a full game made out of 7 cards or 2) a rule card that you can take with you to your favorite taco restaurant. Both have their perks.

—description from the publisher


A 2-4 player game that is played with sauce packets.

Shuffle the packets and place them into a pile of face-up and face-down packets. TAke the top 2 packets off the pile and place them in the center of the table, face-down next to each other.

Players will take turns drawing a packet from the top of the pile(any one that isn't covered by another packet) and then either 1) placing it in front of them for final scoring, or 2) placing it onto the center of the table so that it connects to a minimum of two other packets. After placing it, the player must flip over a packet that is touching it.

The game ends when the last packet is placed. Players score points for the packets in front of them. Each packet is worth 1 point for each face-up matching packet on the center. If there are no matching packets in the center, packets are -1 each.

Nuclear Packets do not score for players, but are wild in the center. They count as the type of any face-up packet that they are touching.


Released in the March 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

boardgame.name: Cookie Scouts VS Aliens
boardgame.description:
It's that time of year again, and the Cookie Scouts are out to earn merit badges and sell cookies. But this year there's a bit of a twist: the skies are full of saucers and aliens are trying to take over the town!

Even facing the end of the world, the noble Cookie Scouts are still out to earn those merit badges and deliver cookie orders while fighting to save the world. The whole troop must cooperate to deliver cookie orders, earn merit badges, and help their moms assemble an explosive device to fend off the impending alien invasion.

Yes, you read that right. Explosive device.

The aliens won't go quietly, however, and the Scouts will have to dodge laser beams, explosions, and freeze rays to complete their challenges and save the world!

boardgame.name: Keresis: Quest for the Elements
boardgame.description:
Keresis is a strategic game: A mix of exploration, territory control and resource management. Each player takes the lead of an ancestral tribe and faces his opponents to become the master of the four elements.

The chaotic world of Keresis is about to collapse. To save your tribe, you must find a way to reach the lost shrines. As an explorer, you have a special ability and can unlock new powers later during the game. A shaman and some of your fierce warriors will join you in this unique adventure! Dangerous events may occur at any time during your expedition: Will you play it safe by following well known paths or will you put yourself in danger by exploring uncharted territories? The decision is yours!

Each player takes a turn to play and execute some of the following actions:
Explore
Collect movement points and explore the map / Lay hex tiles and connect them to create paths to follow.

Gather/trade resources
Collect and use the available resources at your disposal: Energy, element stones and powerful action cards.

Control territories / Battle
Use element stones to deploy some of your warriors or expand your domination by invading enemies territories.

Summon your shaman
Protect your territories, rotate them or unleash the mysterious powers contained in the shrines.

Place your amulets
Each amulet placed on a shrine will bring you one step closer to victory! But it won’t be easy: Each territory is only associated with one shrine. Controlling the right kind of territory is key for placing your amulets!

Will be declared winner the first player to place an amulet on each of the four shrines OR the player with the highest score at the end of twenty-four rounds.

UNIQUE GAME FEATURES:
- 2 difficulty levels: Start as a disciple and become a tribe leader! The adaptable rules set offers a challenging and unique game experience for beginners and experienced players.
- Play in team 2 vs 2 with 4 players (Alliance & Betrayal mode).
- 2 modular board games and 60 unique hex tiles offer near infinite map layouts: You will need to use a different strategy and adapt it each game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: ¡Aúpa Racing! Real Racing Club Santander
boardgame.description:
¡Aúpa Racing! the first board game about the Racing Santander from Cantabria.

The board represents a map of Spain with 23 soccer fields. The objective of the game is to reach several of these stadiums, through a corridor that will be crossed by throwing a dice.
It contains 195 questions on the history of the Racing.
3 categories:

Matches - Protagonistas (75),
Games - Partidazos (65) and
Club (55).


Each question comes with 3 answers and a photograph is used as a clue to facilitate the correct answer.

boardgame.name: Catan: Das Duell – Finstere & Goldene Zeiten
boardgame.description: Catan: Das Duell – Finstere & Goldene Zeiten ("Dark & Golden Times") contains six theme sets to expand Rivals for Catan, with you being able to fend off barbarian raids, discover new islands, and more.

boardgame.name: Sky Towers
boardgame.description:
Sky Towers is a family friendly card game, in which you are building towers of cards. When your tower adds up to 21, you set it aside and keep building. Most cards have an ability or limitation. The challenge is that you cannot play a card that matches the top card in the other players' tower. Points, represented by yellow kites, are counted at the end of the game. Most points wins.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Monster 12
boardgame.description:
Midnight is monster time, and the fun begins at 12 o'clock sharp when the cheeky guys come out of their hiding places. Time to catch them as quickly as you can!

On your turn in Monster 12, you roll dice to try to match monsters because you can take only the three dice that match the color of the monsters on the face-up cards. If you reach the value of the respective monster, then you place the dice on it, and whoever first catches twelve monsters of different colors wins.

boardgame.name: Das NEINhorn
boardgame.description:

In this quick-playing card game, players take turns revealing a card, then immediately saying the word that matches the revealed animal — but this won't necessarily be easy...

boardgame.name: Poco Pinata
boardgame.description:
Poco Pinata is a micro-game that features only a handful of cards that has players take on one of two roles. One player closes their eyes and spins like it was there turn with the bat at a kids’ birthday party. Then they try to smack their token (they suggest coins) on one of the pinata cards on the table. Other players get a chance to move a card while the active player’s eyes are closed to try and stop them from hitting it and getting the candy. It’s a fun little game that is light for all audiences and it’s always fun to see people spinning around like fools and shouting.


Ryan Cowler's Poco Pinata (originally named A Lotta Piñata) is a dizzy dexterity game where you slap coins onto piñatas, trying to burst them for the candy inside.


Released in the May 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

boardgame.name: Scrumdiddlyumptious
boardgame.description:
A yummy deduction game that will fill your belly.

In May, we went with a candy theme. The film was one of the cultiest of the cult films, yet also a family film based on a non-cult book... Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory.

Matthew O' Malley (Diner, Between Two Cities, Knot Dice) and Peter O' Malley designed Scrumdiddlyumptious, a deduction game that uses candy as its pieces! It's pure confection. I mean pure perfection. Or pure imagination? Anyway, it's so good, especially when you can eat the candy. :)

The art was completed by my daughter Beatrix Tagmire and son Leon Tagmire. It felt too fitting to not have kids do the artwork.

—description from the publisher


You actually play with real candy. Players grab handfuls of candy with different types (different colors, different brands, etc), and hide their stash from the other players. They then take turns using powers described on the card trying to get another player to eat pieces from their stash. The last person with candy still in their stash wins. But is losing really so terrible when it means you get to eat all that candy?


Postcard released in the May 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Books: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory

boardgame.name: Rock Paper Kittens
boardgame.description:
Ben Begeal's Rock Paper Kittens is an RPS game that pauses for some social shenanigans.

All 3 cards are shuffled and placed face down on the table. The active player will look at 2 cards, choose to keep one as their role and placing the other back on the table face down. With two cards remaining, the active player will offer one to the other player. That player will choose to take the card offered or the other face down card as their weapons. Roles are resolved by RPS rules.

—description from the publisher


Released in the April 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

boardgame.name: Wallachia: Reign of Dracula
boardgame.description:
Fast-paced! Non-stop action! Retro-style! A platform game inspired by great video game classics (Castlevania). Full of shooting and deadly traps that will quench your thirst for blood.

FEATURES:
▪ 100% of retro,
▪ 100% of action,
▪ 7 action-packed levels,
▪ story based on Vlad the Impaler,
▪ waves of enemies to fight,
▪ bosses that won't give you a chance,
▪ minigames, unlockables and bonuses (e.g. exclusive bonus from Bloodstained Ritual of the Night),
▪ full English voiceover by professional actors (Kira Buckland and Robert Belgrade),
▪ unique & ultra ambient soundtrack!

ABOUT THE GAME:
Wallachia: Reign of Dracula is an action & shooter platformer inspired by great video game classics (e.g. Castlevania).
The game will challenge your reflex, aim and agility skills.
It's unparalleled difficulty will satisfy fans of old-school, unforgiving and complex gameplay.
Watch out for enemies attacking you from every direction, hidden traps and ruthless bosses!
The game has a full, professional voice-over by professional actors, Kira Buckland and Robert Belgrade.
You will enjoy a unique soundtrack and story revolving around the one and only true vampire - Vlad the Impaler.

Thirsty for some blood?
Then get ready for a brutal, yet satisfying adventure!
Travel through the land of Wallachia and face the forces of Vlad Dracula!

(from Nintendo.com website)

boardgame.name: Fantascatti Occhio al Tranello
boardgame.description:
Tommy is a young detective who specialized himself in very peculiar cases.
Despite his age, he is not afraid to explore old abandoned castles, armed only with a camera, looking for scary ghosts. However, the ghost Tommy is looking for is very shy. Therefore, it tries to deceive the young detective with tricks.

Players reveal a trick card, which depicts a different trick among 4 kinds (visual, linguistic, logical, numerical). To solve it, players have to compare the revealed card with the trick deck’s top card. Only the fastest player will be able to catch the right object.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Mediterralien
boardgame.description:
An asymmetric clash of board game styles. One player is a merchant shipping goods through the Mediterranean Sea (worker placement, action selection). The other player is an alien bent on destruction (die rolls / special powers).


Released in the January 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.

boardgame.name: The Time Warp
boardgame.description:
A drafting game about sharing things up.

Cult Film Postcard Game: The Time Warp, inspired by the cult classic The Rocky Horror Picture Show. It was designed by Dead of Winter’s Jonathan Gilmour and Curtis E. Clark.


Postcard released in the July 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.


GOAL
Make the best 5 card poker hand out of your six cards after 3 rounds.

SETUP
Shuffle the deck and deal 3 cards to each player. Place the remaining deck in the center within reach of all players.

GAMEPLAY
Perform the following steps in order (each step consist in a specific way of drafting, drawing or playing cards):

It's just a jump to the left
Then a step to the riiiiiiight
With your hands to your hips
You bring your knees in tiiiiight
But it's the pelvic trust
That really drives you insaaaane
Let's do the Time Warp again


GAME END
After three rounds, players will reveal their hands, comparing to see who has made the best 5 card poker hand.
They have Time Warped the best.

boardgame.name: Trump Wall
boardgame.description:
Trump Wall is a game for 2 players or two teams of 2 players where one person/team is trying to connect the Pacific Ocean to the Caribbean Sea and the other person/team is trying to connect Mexico to the United States.

The game board shows a hex grid, and each hex is labeled with either a traditional card suit (e.g. hearts or clubs) or a traditional card rank (e.g. Ace, 3, 4, Jack). The rules state that the game does not come with the necessary writing implements or playing cards, and that you should charge Mexico for the cost of these.

On a turn, a player chooses to either play a card from their hand and mark an appropriate hex for their side or pass. If a player passes, they discard their hand and draw replacement cards for each and one additional card. If a player did play a card and mark a hex, they also draw one card.

The game ends when one player/team connects their two-sides through hexes marked for their side.

boardgame.name: Free Radicals
boardgame.description:
In Free Radicals, players take control of one of ten fully asymmetrical factions, each with its own path to earn resources, power, and the knowledge stored in the "Free Radicals", which are giant mysterious objects that appeared around the world, causing a huge evolutionary leap in technology. You might play as the merchants, using action points to travel to different markets, and grow in influence and efficiency; the Couriers, using your drones to pick up and deliver valuable goods; the Entertainers, using card placement and abilities to maximize powerful abilities; or one of seven other entirely unique factions!

Players also interact through the main board, where they can visit each other's buildings and try to unlock the technology in one of the free radicals. You can even help your opponents' research in return for influence and other rewards!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Reacher, Hot Lap League, and Free Radicals - Ep150

boardgame.name: Defcon
boardgame.description:
After two global conflicts, we have seen a long time of apparent peace. However, behind fragile stability, enormous strengths were moving. Big transnational factors, such as globalization, world population growth, a shortage of raw materials, and the formation of international actors, have weakened pluralism in favor of a growing polarization on the international stage. In today's world, a few big regional powers compete for world domination.

In Defcon, internal frictions push decision-makers to look for international success to consolidate their power, even though it means conflict against international rivalries. In a climate of growing tension, megapowers begin an arms race to be prepared for a global scale conflict. Whoever controls the hegemonic megapower at the end of the fifth round wins, and to do this, that player must obtain the highest position on the consensus index, which is made up of two separate rankings: the reputation index and the military index. Those who will find the right balance between military strength and support from public opinion will win the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Mocarstwa: Wydanie II Rozszerzone
boardgame.description:
Mocarstwa is a strategic game with elements of the economy, the action of which takes place in 18th-century Europe.

It introduces us to the political and economic realities of that period, allowing us to play the role of the ruler of one of the nine powers: Poland, France, Spain, Hungary, Germany, Great Britain, Sweden, Russia or the Ottoman Empire.

The player can command an army, develop his empire and conduct political negotiations with other players. The goal is to gain control over most of Europe.

This second extended edition adds:

new game mechanics based on Combat Cards eliminate the randomness of the game and significantly accelerate its course
new scenarios, also in solo mode
Power Cards that give each ruler individual options
additional types of troops

boardgame.name: Farmerstein
boardgame.description:
The life of a farmer is hard: hands covered with calluses, waking up at dawn, smelling manure constantly...in short, a nightmare. This is why some tired farmers have decided to make the most sensible choice: Follow the legacy of Doctor Farmerstein, and devote themselves to conquering the world! With a large number of potions and mutagenic agents, they are now capable of giving life to plants to build a fearsome and large army!

In the card game Farmerstein, you play the role of mad scientists who launch their GMOs to conquer the world, with your soldiers being asparagus, mushrooms, cucumbers, and tomatoes mutated into monstrous bloodthirsty creatures. Your goal is to conquer three continents — America, Europe, and Asia — and to do this you need to combine your vegetables and chemicals in the order required by the target cards. The game involves a lot of twisted interactions between players, but with one huge problem in common: the invasion of zombie zucchini, creatures so out of control that nobody can stop them!
